intro: Heterotropa melanosiphon, commonly known as the black-siphon heterotropa, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often pubescent. The flowers are typically small and clustered in cymes, with four to five petals. It produces small, spherical berries that contain several seeds. This plant is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and woodlands.
